instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3023 green light flashing on off
threads.message:
mac book air 820-3023 green light flashing on off
the power turn on and off it had some water damage I clean but no luck where should i start

threads.title: 820-3023 green light flashing on off
threads.message:
What about voltages?
Do you note fluctuations, where?
Which areas affected by liquid spill?

threads.title: 820-3023 green light flashing on off
threads.message:
PPBUS_G3H 5.3v  flashing down to lower voltage 
PP3V42_G3H. 3.43v flashing
PP5V_S5 5v flashing
PP3V3_S5. 3.3v flashing
PLT_RESET_L 0v
PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK 0v
SMC_ONOFF_L 3,43v flashing
PM_PWRBTN_L 0.1 to 0.5v flashing 3.6 kila ohms to ground
PM_SLP_S4_L 0v
PM_SLP_S3_L 0v

threads.title: 820-3023 green light flashing on off
threads.message:
So you don't get stable PPBUS_G3H.
What about PPDCIN_G3H?
Did you try with fake charger, or lab PSU?

threads.title: 820-3023 green light flashing on off
threads.message: THANKS ITS FIXED IT WAS A BAD R7080
